content.description: climb the large corners (5-4) and belay above them. finish up easy (5-2) dike. Make belay on bushes and pockets. the corners are on good granite. The dike is on brown slightly deteriorating though solid granite.
content.protection: good medium size to medium large pro in corners. The dike has no pro.
content.location: Dickey Ledge- Before walking down to the base of the tongue of rock the corners are obviously there in front of you.

content.description:
More high quality climbing. Weaving through the headwall is good fun.  

  P1 150' 5.6+   Climb up past two bolts to a low angle slab. A quick jog will take you to the bottom of the headwall. Climb the headwall (gear) past a short hand crack aiming for a lone bolt at the crest. From the last bolt move up and left to a bolted belay. 

  P2 100' 5.1    Scramble up to the top.
content.protection: 3 Bolts and a short hand/fist sized crack
content.location: This route starts at the very bottom of the Central Tongue at some bolts.

content.description: Start on left side of main slab and diagonal traverse and up to the end of the right side. Crux is above the shallow corner. I just felt like soloing the slab so I  did.
content.location: Dickey Ledge- Base of Dickey lowest on the central tongue.

content.description: Climb ramps with shallow corner for pro and belay at corner's top. Head left through steep section little pro (t.c.u. will work best here) past this bulge (5.6) and climb to summit (5.1). Make believe there is a belay in some pockets and short bushes. There's a 4 star variation to our climb. Don't belay at corner top. Keep going slightly right to good belay ledge after passing one bolt on (5.6) friction face. from here continue straight up (5.1) to top make the same pretend it'll work belay.
content.protection: Trad rack, nothing big. One 27 year old 1/4 bolt (that needs replacement) protects the face crux and we didn't place it.
content.location: From the base of Dickey Ledge, walk to the high point on the left or west side, above the main tongue of Dickey the slab. Start here. You can do some (5.6) no protection friction up to this place. Our first ascent did and it is clean but unprotected for 60ft.

content.description: A long clean 300 foot low angle slab with some bulges in it's middle section. Likely home some of the cliffs first routes. There are some nice long moderate lines with very long run outs.
